The definitive test came on November 12, 1906.

Mint Stamp: The mint stamp on this Cover was issued
by Zaire in 1978. It depicts two pioneer aircraft, the
14 bis of Alberto Santos-Dumont and the Wright Flyer
of Americans Orville and Wilbur Wright.
nesses with measuring devices recorded the mile-
stone — a flight of 722 feet at 25.65 miles per hour. It
was a world's distance and speed record for heavier-
than-air craft.
Postmark: This Cover was postmarked in Paris, France
on November 12, 1984, the exact anniversary of the
first man-powered flight in Europe.

properties.sfomuseum:description: Airmail flight cover, part of International Tributes to the History of Flight series by the Postal Commemorative Society; white envelope with full color illustration cachet and inset stamp commemorating first/inaugural man-powered flight in Europe on November 12, 1906, in Paris, France, by Alberto Santos-Dumont with 14 bis tail-first box-kite plane; commemorative cancellation stamp dated November 12, 1984 in Paris; includes information on reverse.
properties.wof:name: airmail flight cover: First man-powered flight in Europe commemorative
